III.	Facility Identification
The Costco facility is located at 7320 Lisbon Road in Morris, Illinois. The facility processes ground beef and hot dogs. The NAICS code for the processes at the facility is 311612.  Many areas of the plant are refrigerated to maintain temperature in the production and storage areas.

The facility uses ammonia for refrigeration, and is regulated under 40 CFR Part 68, the EPA RMP Rule. There is one RMP regulated refrigeration system onsite that is used for refrigerating meat products. The amount of ammonia currently present in this refrigeration system is approximately 70,000 pounds, which is above the minimum threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds. 

An aerial map identifying the site location is included as Appendix A. 

IV.	Hazard Assessment  Worst Case Scenario (WCS)
Appendix B consists of the RMP*Submit Printout and contains additional information on the worst-case scenario.  Appendix C consists of the offsite consequence analysis data and maps for the worst case release scenario. 

The toxic endpoint distance is 1.2 miles for the worst case scenario. Based upon year 2010 census data, the population within a radius of 1.2 miles is 3,203.

V.	Hazard Assessment  Alternative Release Scenario (ARS)
Appendix B consists of the RMP*Submit Printout and contains additional information on the alternate scenario.  Appendix D consists of the offsite consequence analysis data and maps for the alternative release scenario. 

The toxic endpoint distance is 0.2 miles for the alternative release scenario. Based upon year 2010 census data, the population within a radius of 0.2 miles is 2. In addition, a small population group may be affected by the ARS due to the close proximity of commercial business to the facility. 

VI.	General Accidental Release Prevention Program
A prevention program is in place to minimize the risk of hazardous chemical releases i

n accordance with the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR 1910.119) and the EPA Risk Management Program. This prevention program covers those processes that handle ammonia above the threshold quantity for both PSM and RMP rules. An audit of the PSM program was conducted on Setpember 16, 2020 and the next audit take place on, or before, September 16, 2023 in compliance with the requirement to conduct PSM audits every three years.  The elements of the PSM / Program 3 prevention program and a brief description are listed below.
	Employee Participation  Costco has developed a site-specific employee participation plan that ensures employees and their representatives are consulted when conducting and developing process hazard analyses and other information required to be developed under the PSM/RMP regulation.  In addition, the employee participation program ensures employees and their representatives have access to process hazard analyses and all other information required to be developed under PSM/RMP.  Employees at Costco have assisted in developing the initial PHA and have assisted in revalidating the PHA every five years. In addition, employees have assisted in the development of other PSM/RMP information such as the development of operating and preventative maintenance procedures and management of change.
	Process Safety Information  Costco has developed a site-specific PSI program that ensures information pertaining to the hazards, technology, and equipment of the process are properly developed and maintained. Process safety information for the ammonia process has been compiled and was last reviewed and updated as of August 19, 2022.
	Process Hazard Analysis  Costco has developed a site-specific PHA program that ensures a PHA is conducted initially, at a minimum of every five (5) years, and whenever a change is significant enough    to require a change in PSI.  In addition, this program has been established to ensure PHAs are conducted in ac

cordance with OSHA and EPA regulations and to ensure findings and recommendations of PHAs are properly documented. The last PHA revalidation was completed on August 19, 2022.
	Operating Procedures  Costco has developed a site-specific procedure that ensures operating procedures provide clear instruction for different phases of process operations and ensures they are properly maintained.  Annually, the operating procedures are reviewed and certified as accurate. The Standard Operating Procedures were last reviewed on September 8, 2022. 
	Training  Costco has developed a site-specific training procedure that ensures employees operating the ammonia process have the knowledge to safely operate the process, are aware of the potential hazards of the process, and understand the causes of process problems.
	Management of Change  Costco has developed a site-specific management of change procedure that ensures changes (except for replacement in kind) to the ammonia process, such as additions of new equipment or changes in operating, maintenance, or other procedures are documented. 
	Pre-Startup Review  Costco has developed a site-specific pre-startup safety review procedure that ensures a safety review is performed when modifications to the ammonia process are significant enough to require a change in PSI.
	Mechanical Integrity  Costco has developed a site-specific mechanical integrity procedure that ensures written preventative maintenance procedures are developed and maintained, preventative maintenance tests and inspections are properly documented, and employees maintaining the process receive adequate training.  Preventative maintenance procedures have been established within the written operating procedures. In addition, a preventative maintenance database application has been established to assist in documenting and tracking preventative maintenance activities.
	Contractor Qualifications  Costco has developed a site-specific contractor qualification procedur

e that ensures all contract employers safety performance and programs are evaluated, a contract employee injury and illness log is maintained, information of potential hazards are communicated between Costco and the contract employer, and required training and information is communicated, such as the provisions of the emergency action plan and control over entrance into process areas.
	Incident Investigation  Costco has developed a site-specific incident investigation procedure that ensures each incident that either results in a release or could have resulted in a release of anhydrous ammonia is investigated, within 48 hours, by a team of at least one person knowledgeable in the process.  This procedure also makes provisions to ensure a report is prepared at the conclusion of the investigation and findings are promptly addressed. 
	Compliance Audit  The facility has updated a site-specific compliance audit program to ensure compliance audits are conducted at a minimum of every three years. The most recent compliance audit was completed on September 16, 2020 and the next compliance audit will be conducted no later than September 16, 2020.
	Hot Work Permits  Costco has implemented the hot work program and developed a best management practice for hot work and permits.

VII.	Five-Year Accident History
The Costco facility has not had an accidental anhydrous ammonia release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage in the last five years.

VIII.	Emergency Action Program
Costco has developed an Emergency Action Plan to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and the authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of the release. Costco has communicated and trained facility personnel on proper evacuation procedures and has had interaction with the lo

cal Fire Department. Response activities will be coordinated with the Grundy County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC), and the Morris Fire Department. This coordination effort includes providing the fire departments with site diagrams and hazardous material information. Although Costco does not have an onsite hazardous materials response team, selected individuals have received HAZWOPER training through classroom instruction, on-the-job training, and drills. The current HAZWOPER training includes the first responder awareness level and the first responders operations level training. The facility has a windsock present onsite (located on the top of the building over the engine room) for use in determining wind direction in the event of an ammonia release. 

The current Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for anhydrous ammonia is included in Appendix E. 

IX.	Emergency Communications
The telephone numbers of agencies and plant personnel that may be contacted in case of an emergency are included in the facilitys Emergency Action Plan.  

X.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Chemical safety is an important part of Costcos operations. Costco recently conducted an audit of their Process Safety Management Program and has dutifully implemented the recommendations from that audit. Continuous improvement in safety is an important goal for Costco. In addition to the facility EAP, the plant is included in a community emergency response plan developed by the Grundy County Local Emergency Planning Committee. 

XI.	Management Program
Costco has developed a management system to oversee the implementation of the risk management program elements.  This includes assigning a qualified person (or position) to have overall responsibility for the development, implementation, and integration of the risk management program elements.  If any portion of the program is delegated to others, the names or positions of those individuals need to be documented and the lines of authority defined throug
h an organization chart or similar document.  Katie Holck, General Manager, is responsible for overall implementation of the Risk Management Program.
